Alderley Edge 
A month long placement at ApconiX, an integrated toxicology and ion channels 
company. ApconiX offers expertise in areas including ion channel screening, 
target safety assessments and drug project toxicology. Here I am learning 
about the importance of drug safety in drug development from nonclinical 
safety experts. I have been introduced to the essential role of the hERG ion 
channel in cardiac function and its importance in determining the safety of 
a new drug. I am carrying out routine cell culture and learning how to use 
automated patch clamp technology. I am also working on a project where I will 
be using cell biology techniques to culture and develop a cell line using CHO 
cells that express a TRP ion channel. This will require transfection of the DNA 
into my cell culture resulting in a cell line expressing the TRPV1 ion channel. 
This can then be used to test new drugs against the specific target for potential 
new treatments.
